comment:
* This class implements an optimized iterator for
 * descendant, descendant-or-self, or "//foo" patterns.
 * @see org.apache.xpath.axes.LocPathIterator
 * @xsl.usage advanced

variables.name: m_traverser
variables.comment: The traverser to use to navigate over the descendants.

variables.name: m_axis
variables.comment: The axis that we are traversing.

variables.name: m_extendedTypeID
variables.comment: The extended type ID, not set until setRoot.

methods.name: public DTMIterator cloneWithReset() throws CloneNotSupportedException
methods.comment:
*  Get a cloned Iterator that is reset to the beginning
   *  of the query.
   * 
   *  @return A cloned NodeIterator set of the start of the query.
   * 
   *  @throws CloneNotSupportedException

methods.name: public int nextNode()
methods.comment: * Returns the next node in the set and advances the position of the * iterator in the set. After a NodeIterator is created, the first call * to nextNode() returns the first node in the set. * * @return The next Node in the set being iterated over, or * null if there are no more members in that set. * * @throws DOMException * INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if this method is called after the * detach method was invoked.

methods.name: public void setRoot(int context, Object environment)
methods.comment:
* Initialize the context values for this expression
   * after it is cloned.
   *
   * @param context The XPath runtime context for this
   * transformation.

methods.name: public int asNode(XPathContext xctxt) throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
methods.comment:
* Return the first node out of the nodeset, if this expression is * a nodeset expression. This is the default implementation for * nodesets. *

WARNING: Do not mutate this class from this function!

* @param xctxt The XPath runtime context. * @return the first node out of the nodeset, or DTM.NULL.

methods.name: public void detach()
methods.comment: * Detaches the iterator from the set which it iterated over, releasing * any computational resources and placing the iterator in the INVALID * state. Afterdetach has been invoked, calls to * nextNode orpreviousNode will raise the * exception INVALID_STATE_ERR.

methods.name: public int getAxis()
methods.comment:
* Returns the axis being iterated, if it is known.
   * 
   * @return Axis.CHILD, etc., or -1 if the axis is not known or is of multiple 
   * types.

methodNames: public void setRoot(int context, Object environment)
public int asNode(XPathContext xctxt) throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
